content: Digital Forensic Research Center (DFRC), Korea University. Alarm My account Sign out ABOUT US Professor Current Members Alumni & Former Members PUBLICATION Paper Patent Award Standard Book RESEARCH INFRA DFRC Knowledge Base Online Training Courses Glossary of Terms DFRC Reference Datasets OS/App Hash DB Synthetic Evidence DFRC Resources DFRC Tools BOARD Notice News DFRC Board Q&A CONTACT Location Seoul Travel Guide Close Korea UniversityDigital Forensic Research Center Digital Forensic Research Center (DFRC) is a university research center, established within the School of Cybersecurity in Korea University, with a mission to research techniques and procedures for the identification, collection, process, analysis, and presentation of digital evidence in response to cybercrimes and cybersecurity incidents. We are always looking for researchers who are passionate on digital forensics. Digital Forensic Research Center Digital Forensic Research Center (DFRC) is a university research center, established within the School of Cybersecurity in the Korea University, with a mission to research techniques and procedures for the identification, collection, process, analysis, and presentation of digital evidence in response to cybercrimes and cybersecurity incidents. We are always looking for researchers who are passionate on digital forensics. Location RESEARCH AREAS DFRC is conducting research in various fields of digital forensics. We are not limited to digital forensics but are constantly exploring areas we can study, such as AI, vulnerabilities, and system security diagnosis in cybersecurity. Techniques and Processes for Digital ForensicsConduct research on overall technologies and procedures used in the field of digital forensics. Laws and Policiesfor Digital ForensicsResearch the laws and policies needed in the field of digital forensics, and establish relevant standards. Other areas applicable to Digital ForensicsConducts research that can be fused with digital forensics such as cybersecurity, reverse engineering, firmware analysis, and vulnerabilities. Development ofDigital Forensic InfrastructuresBuild a digital forensic infrastructure through various activities such as RDS(Reference Datasets) and online training course.
